intro: Pedicularis philippica, commonly known as the Philippine lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its showy, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange-red. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and meadows. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
